1.text: Michtam of David. Preserve me, O God: for in thee do I put my trust.

2.text: O my soul, thou hast said unto the LORD, Thou art my Lord: my goodness extendeth not to thee;

3.text: But to the saints that are in the earth, and to the excellent, in whom is all my delight.

4.text: Their sorrows shall be multiplied that hasten after another god: their drink offerings of blood will I not offer, nor take up their names into my lips.

5.text: The LORD is the portion of mine inheritance and of my cup: thou maintainest my lot.

6.text: The lines are fallen unto me in pleasant places; yea, I have a goodly heritage.

7.text: I will bless the LORD, who hath given me counsel: my reins also instruct me in the night seasons.

8.text: I have set the LORD always before me: because he is at my right hand, I shall not be moved.

9.text: Therefore my heart is glad, and my glory rejoiceth: my flesh also shall rest in hope.

10.text: For thou wilt not leave my soul in hell; neither wilt thou suffer thine Holy One to see corruption.

11.text: Thou wilt shew me the path of life: in thy presence is fulness of joy; at thy right hand there are pleasures for evermore.
